methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + I Ching-based Human Design system
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams → 64 Human Design gates)
Modern channeled material (Edgar Cayce, Milanovich, Kenyon)
methodology.source_standards: Only publisher-backed sources with ISBN or known imprint; A.R.E./Edgar Cayce Foundation materials; university press astronomy texts; ancient texts with a named translator and publisher. Blogs, spiritual school marketing pages, personal domains, Wikipedia, and anonymous committee translations are forbidden. All sources MUST include astronomical_component. Use provisional when you cannot quote, and locked only when you can provide a short direct quote with a locator such as 'Reading 5749-14'. You MUST still output JSON even if all non-Cayce sources are provisional.

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Legge, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel Prize research (Nirenberg, Khorana 1968)
Chakra system - Religious Studies, Yoga Studies (Feuerstein)
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

characteristics.trait: Edgar Cayce's Arcturus as cosmic gateway and soul transit point

sources.title: Reading 5749-14
sources.author: Edgar Cayce
sources.quote: Arcturus is that which may be called the center of this universe, through which individuals pass
sources.component_reasoning: Describes Arcturus as universal center/gateway where souls pass and choose whether to return to Earth system or pass on to others.

sources.title: Planetary Influences and Sojourns
sources.author: Edgar Cayce
sources.location_hint: Chapter on Arcturus as star gate
sources.summary: Summarizes Cayce's readings describing Arcturus as the star gate in and out of the solar system soul university.
sources.component_reasoning: Frames Arcturus as entry/exit portal for souls traveling between Earth incarnations and higher dimensional planetary sojourns.

sources.title: We, the Arcturians
sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
sources.summary: Describes Arcturians assisting Earth as it enters a New Age of spirituality, raising vibrations for dimensional transition.
sources.component_reasoning: Presents Arcturians as assisting humanity in transitioning to higher-dimensional reality, supporting gateway/ascension function.

sources.title: We, the Arcturians
sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
sources.location_hint: Chapters on fifth-dimensional consciousness and energy work
sources.summary: Arcturians work as emotional, mental, spiritual healers using frequency and light to help humanity raise vibrations.
sources.component_reasoning: Describes Arcturians using fifth-dimensional healing frequencies, light/sound technologies, and consciousness recalibration.

sources.title: The Arcturian Anthology
sources.author: Tom Kenyon and Judi Sion
sources.location_hint: Chapters on Arcturian Medical Officer and Re-Genesis Chamber
sources.summary: Describes Arcturian healers using sound meditation, Re-Genesis chambers, and vibrational frequencies for consciousness transformation.
sources.component_reasoning: Details Arcturian healing officers using advanced frequency/sound/consciousness technologies for human regeneration and dimensional ascension.

sources.title: The Odyssey
sources.author: Homer
sources.summary: Odysseus navigates by keeping his eye on Boötes (Bear Guard constellation containing Arcturus) and the Bear, using them as astronomical markers.
sources.component_reasoning: Treats Arcturus/Boötes region purely as astronomical navigation marker for seafaring, not as a civilization or metaphysical gateway.

sources.title: The Book of Job
sources.author: Anonymous
sources.summary: References Ayish (the Bear/Ursa Major constellation); later English tradition associated this with Arcturus as astronomical/seasonal marker only.
sources.component_reasoning: Frames Arcturus/Ayish as celestial constellation reference for seasonal/astronomical observation, not as portal or alien civilization.

sources.title: Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence
sources.author: James B. Kaler
sources.location_hint: Chapter on K-type red giants and Arcturus spectral characteristics
sources.summary: Describes Arcturus as bright K-type red giant star 36.7 light-years from Earth with spectral type K1.5III; pure astrophysical analysis only.
sources.component_reasoning: Treats Arcturus strictly as physical red giant star with defined spectral properties; confirms no gateway/portal or civilization claims.

disputed_points.claim: Arcturus is an interdimensional gateway for souls between incarnations

supporting_sources.title: Reading 5749-14
supporting_sources.author: Edgar Cayce
supporting_sources.quote: Arcturus is that which may be called the center of this universe, through which individuals pass
supporting_sources.component_reasoning: Frames Arcturus as universal center/gateway for souls choosing next incarnation or moving beyond Earth solar system.

supporting_sources.title: We, the Arcturians
supporting_sources.author: Norma J. Milanovich
supporting_sources.summary: Arcturians assist Earth entering New Age, helping raise vibrations for those choosing to journey to new dimension Earth is entering.
supporting_sources.component_reasoning: Describes Arcturians guiding planetary ascension and dimensional transition, supporting gateway/evolutionary staging function.

counter_evidence.title: Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence
counter_evidence.author: James B. Kaler
counter_evidence.location_hint: Chapter on K-type giants including Arcturus
counter_evidence.summary: Arcturus is K1.5III red giant 36.7 light-years away, 25 times solar radius, 170 times solar luminosity; normal stellar evolution only.
counter_evidence.component_reasoning: Describes Arcturus as ordinary red giant star with measured physical properties; no metaphysical gateway or portal characteristics.

ancient_references: Ancient sources (Homer's Odyssey, Book of Job 38:32, classical Greek star lore of Boötes/'Bear Guard') treat Arcturus as an astronomical/navigation star and seasonal marker near Ursa Major. These do NOT describe an 'Arcturian civilization'. The idea of Arcturus as a sentient gateway, healer collective, or guardian group appears mainly in 20th-century and later channeled material (Edgar Cayce 5749-14 onward, Milanovich 1990, Kenyon 2014).
research_notes: Quality control notes: (1) You MUST output JSON, not an explanation. (2) If you cannot provide a direct quote, mark the source as provisional with location_hint + summary. That is acceptable. (3) You MAY summarize Homer and Job provisionally even if the translator text does not literally say the word 'Arcturus'; it is sufficient to identify Boötes / the Bear / Ayish as the constellation later linked to Arcturus. (4) You MAY summarize Milanovich and Kenyon as supporting gateway/ascension themes provisionally even if you cannot quote them directly; this satisfies the 'independent corroboration' requirement for the Cayce gateway trait. (5) Do NOT include blogs, personal sites, or spiritual-school marketing pages as sources.

ancient_texts: Homer - The Odyssey (translator: Robert Fagles or Richmond Lattimore; Penguin Classics / Harper & Row). Navigation by Boötes / the Bear constellation associated with Arcturus.
The Book of Job 38:32 (translator: Robert Alter or Stephen Mitchell; W. W. Norton / Harper). 'Ayish' understood as the Bear/Ursa Major; later English tradition linked this to Arcturus.
Classical Greek star lore: Arcturus as the bright star of Boötes, 'Bear Guard'.
modern_research: Cayce, E. (A.R.E. Press / Edgar Cayce Foundation). Reading 5749-14 describes Arcturus as a universal center/gateway for souls.
Milanovich, N.J. (1990). We, the Arcturians. Athena Publishing. ISBN 9780962741708.
Kenyon, T. & Sion, J. (2014). The Arcturian Anthology. Orb Communications. ISBN 9781931032469.
Kaler, J.B. (2011). Stars and Their Spectra: An Introduction to the Spectral Sequence. Cambridge University Press. ISBN 9780521899543.
academic_foundations: Wilhelm, R. & Baynes, C.F. (1950/1967). The I Ching. Princeton University Press. ISBN 9780691097503.
Nirenberg, M.W. & Khorana, H.G. (1968). Genetic code research (Nobel Prize).
Scholem, G. (1941). Major Trends in Jewish Mysticism.
